result.execSummary:
The defendant Jon Jerald Dahl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: A woman called on behalf of DE stating that she cannot get thru 888# to make pymt for the DE.  Woman was advised to double ck the number she is dialing & that I would contact GovPayNet to see if they are having processing issues. jaf

DE called to request to mail pymt today.  DE is approved to mail pymt today, but was advised that pymts should be mailed before their due date in the future.  DE was also given his case # to put on pymt & advised to put his return address on the envelope. jaf
JOC returned from PO "Not deliverable as addressed". eif

ADDRESS INFO for Jon Jerald Dahl
Current: 311 W Pine St, River Falls, WI 54022 United States  (Effective: 12-16-2015)
Prior: 1766 Bennett Street, River Falls, WI 54022
c: Def, Atty, DA & NRPD. eif
DE to pay $25/mo comm 2-01-16.  $15 PPF added.  DE signed PPA. jaf
signed by Def & Atty this date. eif

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Alex McKinley, DF ATTY:  Alex Stormont, DF: Jon Jerald Dahl appeared.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  State moves to amend Ct. 1 to Statutes 943.50(1m)(b) (Misdemeanor Retail Theft).  Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  DE pleads Guilty to the amended Ct 1.  Guilty plea is entered.  Crt reviews New Richmond Police Report.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE adjudicated guilty of the amended Ct 1.  Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:


- Court orders F/F of $250 inclusive of costs. 
- 20 hours of Community service within 60 days from todays hearing
- DE to meet with the Payment Clerk to set up a payment plan
- 20 days to appeal

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Super Walmart in New Richmond.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: EJL, RPR: Val Deiss, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Alexis S. Mckinley,  DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski,  DF:  Jon Jerald Dahl appeared from jail. Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. Prelim demanded.  Waive speedy prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 09:30 am.
